query: How can we identify therapeutic strategies for ARID1A-deficient Ovarian Cancer using synthetic lethality?

properties.function: Component of SWI/SNF chromatin remodeling complexes. Binds DNA non-specifically. Essential for neural progenitor self-renewal and proliferation.
properties.role: Loss-of-function driver mutation in ovarian cancer

properties.mechanism: Paralog of ARID1A; synthetic lethal dependency in ARID1A-deficient cells

nodes.label: EZH2
nodes.name: enhancer of zeste 2 polycomb repressive complex 2 subunit

properties.function: Catalytic subunit of PRC2 complex. Methylates H3K27 leading to transcriptional repression.
properties.mechanism: Synthetic lethal dependency in ARID1A-deficient cancers via chromatin remodeling antagonism

properties.function: Serine/threonine kinase activating checkpoint signaling upon DNA damage.
properties.mechanism: Synthetic lethal dependency in ARID1A-deficient cancers due to increased replication stress

nodes.label: ATARI Trial
nodes.name: ATr Inhibitor in Combination With Olaparib/Durvalumab in Gynaecological Cancers With ARID1A Loss or no Loss

properties.primary_sponsor: Institute of Cancer Research, United Kingdom
properties.significance: First trial specifically targeting ARID1A-deficient gynaecological cancers with ATR inhibition

nodes.label: Tazemetostat in Ovarian/Endometrial Cancer
nodes.name: Phase II Study of Tazemetostat in Recurrent or Persistent Endometrioid or Clear Cell Carcinoma

properties.target_population: Ovarian clear cell carcinoma with ARID1A mutations (amended criteria)
properties.enrollment_criteria: Only OCCC with ARID1A pathologic variants eligible (as of Oct 2021 amendment)

nodes.label: Senaparib + Temozolomide
nodes.name: Study of Senaparib in Combination With Temozolomide in ARID1A Mutation Associated Ovarian Cancer

properties.target_population: ARID1A mutation associated ovarian, fallopian tube, or primary peritoneal cancer
properties.primary_sponsor: Sidney Kimmel Comprehensive Cancer Center at Johns Hopkins
properties.mechanism: PARP inhibition + alkylating agent in ARID1A-deficient context

properties.relationship: Loss-of-function mutations in ARID1A occur in ~50% of ovarian clear cell carcinomas and ~30% of endometrioid ovarian cancers

properties.mechanism: ARID1A and ARID1B are paralogous subunits of SWI/SNF complexes. Loss of ARID1A creates dependency on ARID1B for chromatin remodeling function.
SWI/SNF (containing ARID1A) and PRC2 (containing EZH2) have antagonistic roles in chromatin regulation. ARID1A loss creates dependency on EZH2.
ARID1A loss causes increased replication stress and DNA damage, creating dependency on ATR-mediated checkpoint signaling.

properties.relationship: Salt form of tazemetostat with identical target

properties.biomarker: ARID1A pathologic variant or likely pathogenic variant
properties.strategy: PARP inhibition (senaparib) + temozolomide in ARID1A-deficient context

metadata.validation_status: All NCT IDs verified via ClinicalTrials.gov API
